category.name: writing
description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group
organizer.name: Aaron Digulla

category.name: writing
description:
A group for anyone interested in meeting up for creative writing sessions in a cafe setting. Bring your laptop or your paper & pen, order a drink or a snack, and let's do some writing.  This is open to any writers, no matter what genre, language, or style you're writing in.

Meeting formats:

Start with a 10-minute free write prompt, then 30 minutes of writing on our own material, afterwards we keep going if we're on a roll or we stop and hang out.
name: Zürich Writing Sessions

category.name: writing
description:
Zurich Storytellers is a meetup of people who want to learn (more) how to craft good stories and an opportunity to practice telling them in a supportive friendly atmosphere.

Gain advice from experienced storytellers how to craft and tell your story in a compelling way. 

Stories shape the way we perceive our own causes and whether others will care about them. By giving purpose to our actions, the stories we tell ourselves (and others) are at the core of our success – or lack of it. 


Our meetup's format varies but generally time is divided between learning/sharing techniques of crafting story and discussing the stories members tell at the meetup. Member stories can be prepared in advance or improvised on the spot.

Here are 10 tips to help guide story design from beginning to end:

Hook us. Make us care about you. Paint the scene. Clearly state your fears, desires, the dilemma. Make us invested in the outcome. Introduce the conflict. Make us worried for you. Impress us with observations that are uniquely yours. Pull us into the moment when it all goes down. Conclude as a different person: Victorious? Defeated? Bewildered? Enlightened? …CHANGED.

FORMAT (can vary month to month)
18:00   Drinks and networking 
18:30   Guest storyteller(s), group exercises and discussion 
20:00   Member storytelling and group feedback
21:00   Good byes & networking

Because YOU ARE THE STORY YOU TELL
name: Zurich Storytellers Meetup
organizer.name: Joel Blom

description:
Wir bewegen Worte, damit der Funke überspringt. Es gibt Inspiration für Deine Kommunikation, für Worte voll Feuer. Beginne - vielleicht neu? - eine Liebesbeziehung zum Schreiben und Reden, mit kreativen Übungen und Austausch. In kleiner, persönlicher Runde, eine Begegnung am Feuer. Geniesse bei Wein und Food einen Abend für Deine lebendige Sprache.

Anmeldung gern per pn oder unter: friederike.kunath@email.de

Wer sind wir? Friederike & Franz von www.schreibstimme.ch, https://www.facebook.com/schreibstimme/…

description:
I am searching for guest bloggers to participate in a lifestyle project entitled 'things I wish I knew in my twenties'. Ideally you'll be somewhere in your twenties, a keen blogger/writer (preferably with your own website) with a bit of life experience and a list of things you wish people had told you before you started adulting.
The size and length of the project will depend on the number of participants and how much we have to write about. So bring your laptop, your ideas and your personality along to the first meet up!

category.name: writing
description:
Salut tout le monde!
Hi everyone! (English version below)


L'objectif de ce groupe est de réunir des gens de tous horizons ayant tous un désir ou un besoin de changement dans leur vie, ainsi qu'une réelle volonté de passer à l'action! On est souvent bien dans seul face au changement, ce qui rend difficile de respecter ses engagements personnels et qui finit par nous faire laisser tomber...
L'idée ici est donc de trouver des personnes dans la même situation pour se motiver les uns les autres et pour que chacun atteignent ses objectifs! On est toujours plus efficace quand on sait que quelque part, quelqu'un compte sur nous pour y arriver!
J'aimerais également en profiter pour partager mon expérience en tant que Coach en Développement Personnel et vous faire découvrir certaines clés, certaines méthodes pour vous aider à Simplifier votre vie!


The purpose of this group is to bring together people from all walks of life, sharing a desire or a need for change in their lives, and a strong willingness to get take action and get started! We often feel alone in the face of change, which makes it difficult to respect our personal commitments and we end up giving up on our goals...
The idea here is to find people in a similar situation to motivate each other and to ensure everyone reaches their goals! We are always more efficient when we know that somewhere, someone is counting on us to succeed!
I would also like to take this opportunity to share with you my experience as a Lifestyle Coach and help you discover some tools and methods that will allow you to Redesign your life!
name: REDESIGN YOUR LIFE
organizer.name: Martin Perrier

category.name: writing
description:
Osons écrire avec le sérieux d'un enfant qui s'amuse !
Vous aimez jouer avec les mots ? Nos ateliers et stages d'écriture sont accessibles à tous. Ils vous invitent à mettre en mots la vie qui palpite autour de vous. Les rencontres, les paysages, les lieux servent de supports à l'inspiration. L'animatrice accompagne l'écriture à partir de propositions variées qui stimulent et éveillent l'imagination. Venez faire le plein des sens : nos ateliers d'écriture cherchent à vous faire recueillir le plus d'informations sensorielles pour les poser sur le papier. Nous privilégions les environnements inspirants et n'hésitons pas à vous emmener à la rencontre d'artistes et artisans de talent pour nourrir la curiosité d'esprit. La création rencontre alors la création et les mots rendent compte des perceptions et ressentis.
name: Les joueurs de mots
organizer.name: ScrivaCom

category.name: writing
description:
Shut Up & Write!™ is more than a movement, more than a good idea. We’re a method of writing that delivers. As an international organization, we are thousands of writers in a worldwide community, but most importantly, we are writers who write together in a local cafe. Join us.

We have events every week, all over. Sometimes we talk after. Whatever you’re writing, whatever form it takes, wherever you are in your process, you won’t be the only one.

And if you need help with your writing, we offer that too. Want to know more? Check us out: www.shutupwrite.com. Or get in touch:
questions@shutupwrite.com.

Meetup Event Format It is an empowering and rewarding experience to write an hour each week, at the same time and place. It serves as powerful support for building your daily writing discipline.

RSVP and please arrive 10–15 minutes early to get settled. At the Meetup our Organizer will lead introductions and then everyone will sit down and write.

Afterwards, feel free to get to know each other. Members often talk about their successes and challenges as writers. The Shut Up & Write!™ format brings a social facet to a normally isolated craft.

Our Meetups are a safe space for writers to work on their craft. No one will read or critique your writing.

“Writing is the only thing that, when I do it, I don't feel I should be doing something else.“ - Gloria Steinem

This is your time to write.
name: Shut Up & Write!™ Bern
organizer.name: Shut Up & Write!

Hook us. Make us care about you. Paint the scene. Clearly state your fears, desires, the dilemma. Make us invested in the outcome. Introduce the conflict. Make us worried for you. Impress us with observations that are uniquely yours. Pull us into the moment when it all goes down. Conclude as a different person: Victorious? Defeated? Bewildered? Enlightened? …CHANGED.

FORMAT (can vary month to month)
18:00   Drinks and networking 
18:30   Guest storyteller(s), group exercises and discussion 
20:00   Member storytelling and group feedback
21:00   Good byes & networking

Because YOU ARE THE STORY YOU TELL

category.name: writing
description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group
organizer.name: Aaron Digulla

category.name: writing
description:
A group for anyone interested in meeting up for creative writing sessions in a cafe setting. Bring your laptop or your paper & pen, order a drink or a snack, and let's do some writing.  This is open to any writers, no matter what genre, language, or style you're writing in.

Meeting formats:

Start with a 10-minute free write prompt, then 30 minutes of writing on our own material, afterwards we keep going if we're on a roll or we stop and hang out.
name: Zürich Writing Sessions

description: Are you suffering from writer's block? Then you are not alone, independent of whether you are writing a thesis, dissertation, research, book, blog or column. description:
Zurich Storytellers is a meetup of people who want to learn (more) how to craft good stories and an opportunity to practice telling them in a supportive friendly atmosphere.

Gain advice from experienced storytellers how to craft and tell your story in a compelling way. 

Stories shape the way we perceive our own causes and whether others will care about them. By giving purpose to our actions, the stories we tell ourselves (and others) are at the core of our success – or lack of it. 


Our meetup's format varies but generally time is divided between learning/sharing techniques of crafting story and discussing the stories members tell at the meetup. Member stories can be prepared in advance or improvised on the spot.

Here are 10 tips to help guide story design from beginning to end:

Hook us. Make us care about you. Paint the scene. Clearly state your fears, desires, the dilemma. Make us invested in the outcome. Introduce the conflict. Make us worried for you. Impress us with observations that are uniquely yours. Pull us into the moment when it all goes down. Conclude as a different person: Victorious? Defeated? Bewildered? Enlightened? …CHANGED.

FORMAT (can vary month to month)
18:00   Drinks and networking 
18:30   Guest storyteller(s), group exercises and discussion 
20:00   Member storytelling and group feedback
21:00   Good byes & networking

Because YOU ARE THE STORY YOU TELL

I am searching for guest bloggers to participate in a lifestyle project entitled 'things I wish I knew in my twenties'. Ideally you'll be somewhere in your twenties, a keen blogger/writer (preferably with your own website) with a bit of life experience and a list of things you wish people had told you before you started adulting.
The size and length of the project will depend on the number of participants and how much we have to write about. So bring your laptop, your ideas and your personality along to the first meet up!
name: In my twenties

category.name: writing
description:
Salut tout le monde!
Hi everyone! (English version below)


L'objectif de ce groupe est de réunir des gens de tous horizons ayant tous un désir ou un besoin de changement dans leur vie, ainsi qu'une réelle volonté de passer à l'action! On est souvent bien dans seul face au changement, ce qui rend difficile de respecter ses engagements personnels et qui finit par nous faire laisser tomber...
L'idée ici est donc de trouver des personnes dans la même situation pour se motiver les uns les autres et pour que chacun atteignent ses objectifs! On est toujours plus efficace quand on sait que quelque part, quelqu'un compte sur nous pour y arriver!
J'aimerais également en profiter pour partager mon expérience en tant que Coach en Développement Personnel et vous faire découvrir certaines clés, certaines méthodes pour vous aider à Simplifier votre vie!


The purpose of this group is to bring together people from all walks of life, sharing a desire or a need for change in their lives, and a strong willingness to get take action and get started! We often feel alone in the face of change, which makes it difficult to respect our personal commitments and we end up giving up on our goals...
The idea here is to find people in a similar situation to motivate each other and to ensure everyone reaches their goals! We are always more efficient when we know that somewhere, someone is counting on us to succeed!
I would also like to take this opportunity to share with you my experience as a Lifestyle Coach and help you discover some tools and methods that will allow you to Redesign your life!
name: REDESIGN YOUR LIFE
organizer.name: Martin Perrier

category.name: writing
description:
Shut Up & Write!™ is more than a movement, more than a good idea. We’re a method of writing that delivers. As an international organization, we are thousands of writers in a worldwide community, but most importantly, we are writers who write together in a local cafe. Join us.

We have events every week, all over. Sometimes we talk after. Whatever you’re writing, whatever form it takes, wherever you are in your process, you won’t be the only one.

And if you need help with your writing, we offer that too. Want to know more? Check us out: www.shutupwrite.com. Or get in touch:
questions@shutupwrite.com.

Meetup Event Format It is an empowering and rewarding experience to write an hour each week, at the same time and place. It serves as powerful support for building your daily writing discipline.

RSVP and please arrive 10–15 minutes early to get settled. At the Meetup our Organizer will lead introductions and then everyone will sit down and write.

Afterwards, feel free to get to know each other. Members often talk about their successes and challenges as writers. The Shut Up & Write!™ format brings a social facet to a normally isolated craft.

Our Meetups are a safe space for writers to work on their craft. No one will read or critique your writing.

“Writing is the only thing that, when I do it, I don't feel I should be doing something else.“ - Gloria Steinem

This is your time to write.
name: Shut Up & Write!™ Bern
organizer.name: Shut Up & Write!

category.name: writing
description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group
organizer.name: Aaron Digulla

category.name: writing
description:
A group for anyone interested in meeting up for creative writing sessions in a cafe setting. Bring your laptop or your paper & pen, order a drink or a snack, and let's do some writing.  This is open to any writers, no matter what genre, language, or style you're writing in.

Meeting formats:

Start with a 10-minute free write prompt, then 30 minutes of writing on our own material, afterwards we keep going if we're on a roll or we stop and hang out.
name: Zürich Writing Sessions

category.name: writing
description:
Zurich Storytellers is a meetup of people who want to learn (more) how to craft good stories and an opportunity to practice telling them in a supportive friendly atmosphere.

Gain advice from experienced storytellers how to craft and tell your story in a compelling way. 

Stories shape the way we perceive our own causes and whether others will care about them. By giving purpose to our actions, the stories we tell ourselves (and others) are at the core of our success – or lack of it. 


Our meetup's format varies but generally time is divided between learning/sharing techniques of crafting story and discussing the stories members tell at the meetup. Member stories can be prepared in advance or improvised on the spot.

Here are 10 tips to help guide story design from beginning to end:

Hook us. Make us care about you. Paint the scene. Clearly state your fears, desires, the dilemma. Make us invested in the outcome. Introduce the conflict. Make us worried for you. Impress us with observations that are uniquely yours. Pull us into the moment when it all goes down. Conclude as a different person: Victorious? Defeated? Bewildered? Enlightened? …CHANGED.

FORMAT (can vary month to month)
18:00   Drinks and networking 
18:30   Guest storyteller(s), group exercises and discussion 
20:00   Member storytelling and group feedback
21:00   Good byes & networking

Because YOU ARE THE STORY YOU TELL
name: Zurich Storytellers Meetup
organizer.name: Joel Blom

category.name: writing
description:
Wir bewegen Worte, damit der Funke überspringt. Es gibt Inspiration für Deine Kommunikation, für Worte voll Feuer. Beginne - vielleicht neu? - eine Liebesbeziehung zum Schreiben und Reden, mit kreativen Übungen und Austausch. In kleiner, persönlicher Runde, eine Begegnung am Feuer. Geniesse bei Wein und Food einen Abend für Deine lebendige Sprache.

Anmeldung gern per pn oder unter: friederike.kunath@email.de

Wer sind wir? Friederike & Franz von www.schreibstimme.ch, https://www.facebook.com/schreibstimme/…
name: SchreibStimme Apéro: On fire!

category.name: writing
description:
Zurich Storytellers is a meetup of people who want to learn (more) how to craft good stories and an opportunity to practice telling them in a supportive friendly atmosphere.

Gain advice from experienced storytellers how to craft and tell your story in a compelling way. 

Stories shape the way we perceive our own causes and whether others will care about them. By giving purpose to our actions, the stories we tell ourselves (and others) are at the core of our success – or lack of it. 


Our meetup's format varies but generally time is divided between learning/sharing techniques of crafting story and discussing the stories members tell at the meetup. Member stories can be prepared in advance or improvised on the spot.

Here are 10 tips to help guide story design from beginning to end:

Hook us. Make us care about you. Paint the scene. Clearly state your fears, desires, the dilemma. Make us invested in the outcome. Introduce the conflict. Make us worried for you. Impress us with observations that are uniquely yours. Pull us into the moment when it all goes down. Conclude as a different person: Victorious? Defeated? Bewildered? Enlightened? …CHANGED.

FORMAT (can vary month to month)
18:00   Drinks and networking 
18:30   Guest storyteller(s), group exercises and discussion 
20:00   Member storytelling and group feedback
21:00   Good byes & networking

Because YOU ARE THE STORY YOU TELL
name: Zurich Storytellers Meetup

description:
Wir bewegen Worte, damit der Funke überspringt. Es gibt Inspiration für Deine Kommunikation, für Worte voll Feuer. Beginne - vielleicht neu? - eine Liebesbeziehung zum Schreiben und Reden, mit kreativen Übungen und Austausch. In kleiner, persönlicher Runde, eine Begegnung am Feuer. Geniesse bei Wein und Food einen Abend für Deine lebendige Sprache.

Anmeldung gern per pn oder unter: friederike.kunath@email.de

Wer sind wir? Friederike & Franz von www.schreibstimme.ch, https://www.facebook.com/schreibstimme/…

category.name: writing
description:
I am searching for guest bloggers to participate in a lifestyle project entitled 'things I wish I knew in my twenties'. Ideally you'll be somewhere in your twenties, a keen blogger/writer (preferably with your own website) with a bit of life experience and a list of things you wish people had told you before you started adulting.
The size and length of the project will depend on the number of participants and how much we have to write about. So bring your laptop, your ideas and your personality along to the first meet up!
name: In my twenties

category.name: writing
description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group
organizer.name: Aaron Digulla

category.name: writing
description:
A group for anyone interested in meeting up for creative writing sessions in a cafe setting. Bring your laptop or your paper & pen, order a drink or a snack, and let's do some writing.  This is open to any writers, no matter what genre, language, or style you're writing in.

Meeting formats:

Start with a 10-minute free write prompt, then 30 minutes of writing on our own material, afterwards we keep going if we're on a roll or we stop and hang out.
name: Zürich Writing Sessions
organizer.name: Dustin B

category.name: writing
description: Are you suffering from writer's block? Then you are not alone, independent of whether you are writing a thesis, dissertation, research, book, blog or column. This group is intended towards bringing the budding writers together in a fun and friendly places in Zurich where we all can share our pain, experiences, tips and tricks. You do not have walk alone any longer. This group will be there to support you through your writing journey
name: Zürich Writing Club

category.name: writing
description:
Salut tout le monde!
Hi everyone! (English version below)


L'objectif de ce groupe est de réunir des gens de tous horizons ayant tous un désir ou un besoin de changement dans leur vie, ainsi qu'une réelle volonté de passer à l'action! On est souvent bien dans seul face au changement, ce qui rend difficile de respecter ses engagements personnels et qui finit par nous faire laisser tomber...
L'idée ici est donc de trouver des personnes dans la même situation pour se motiver les uns les autres et pour que chacun atteignent ses objectifs! On est toujours plus efficace quand on sait que quelque part, quelqu'un compte sur nous pour y arriver!
J'aimerais également en profiter pour partager mon expérience en tant que Coach en Développement Personnel et vous faire découvrir certaines clés, certaines méthodes pour vous aider à Simplifier votre vie!


The purpose of this group is to bring together people from all walks of life, sharing a desire or a need for change in their lives, and a strong willingness to get take action and get started! We often feel alone in the face of change, which makes it difficult to respect our personal commitments and we end up giving up on our goals...
The idea here is to find people in a similar situation to motivate each other and to ensure everyone reaches their goals! We are always more efficient when we know that somewhere, someone is counting on us to succeed!
I would also like to take this opportunity to share with you my experience as a Lifestyle Coach and help you discover some tools and methods that will allow you to Redesign your life!
name: REDESIGN YOUR LIFE
organizer.name: Martin Perrier

category.name: writing
description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group
organizer.name: Aaron Digulla

category.name: writing
description:
A group for anyone interested in meeting up for creative writing sessions in a cafe setting. Bring your laptop or your paper & pen, order a drink or a snack, and let's do some writing.  This is open to any writers, no matter what genre, language, or style you're writing in.

Meeting formats:

Start with a 10-minute free write prompt, then 30 minutes of writing on our own material, afterwards we keep going if we're on a roll or we stop and hang out.
name: Zürich Writing Sessions

category.name: writing
description: Are you suffering from writer's block? Then you are not alone, independent of whether you are writing a thesis, dissertation, research, book, blog or column. This group is intended towards bringing the budding writers together in a fun and friendly places in Zurich where we all can share our pain, experiences, tips and tricks. You do not have walk alone any longer. This group will be there to support you through your writing journey

category.name: writing
description:
Zurich Storytellers is a meetup of people who want to learn (more) how to craft good stories and an opportunity to practice telling them in a supportive friendly atmosphere.

Gain advice from experienced storytellers how to craft and tell your story in a compelling way. 

Stories shape the way we perceive our own causes and whether others will care about them. By giving purpose to our actions, the stories we tell ourselves (and others) are at the core of our success – or lack of it. 


Our meetup's format varies but generally time is divided between learning/sharing techniques of crafting story and discussing the stories members tell at the meetup. Member stories can be prepared in advance or improvised on the spot.

Here are 10 tips to help guide story design from beginning to end:

Hook us. Make us care about you. Paint the scene. Clearly state your fears, desires, the dilemma. Make us invested in the outcome. Introduce the conflict. Make us worried for you. Impress us with observations that are uniquely yours. Pull us into the moment when it all goes down. Conclude as a different person: Victorious? Defeated? Bewildered? Enlightened? …CHANGED.

FORMAT (can vary month to month)
18:00   Drinks and networking 
18:30   Guest storyteller(s), group exercises and discussion 
20:00   Member storytelling and group feedback
21:00   Good byes & networking

Because YOU ARE THE STORY YOU TELL
name: Zurich Storytellers Meetup
organizer.name: Joel Blom

description:
Wir bewegen Worte, damit der Funke überspringt. Es gibt Inspiration für Deine Kommunikation, für Worte voll Feuer. Beginne - vielleicht neu? - eine Liebesbeziehung zum Schreiben und Reden, mit kreativen Übungen und Austausch. In kleiner, persönlicher Runde, eine Begegnung am Feuer. Geniesse bei Wein und Food einen Abend für Deine lebendige Sprache.

Anmeldung gern per pn oder unter: friederike.kunath@email.de

Wer sind wir? Friederike & Franz von www.schreibstimme.ch, https://www.facebook.com/schreibstimme/…

category.name: writing
description:
I am searching for guest bloggers to participate in a lifestyle project entitled 'things I wish I knew in my twenties'. Ideally you'll be somewhere in your twenties, a keen blogger/writer (preferably with your own website) with a bit of life experience and a list of things you wish people had told you before you started adulting.
The size and length of the project will depend on the number of participants and how much we have to write about. So bring your laptop, your ideas and your personality along to the first meet up!

category.name: writing
description:
Shut Up & Write!™ is more than a movement, more than a good idea. We’re a method of writing that delivers. As an international organization, we are thousands of writers in a worldwide community, but most importantly, we are writers who write together in a local cafe. Join us.

We have events every week, all over. Sometimes we talk after. Whatever you’re writing, whatever form it takes, wherever you are in your process, you won’t be the only one.

And if you need help with your writing, we offer that too. Want to know more? Check us out: www.shutupwrite.com. Or get in touch:
questions@shutupwrite.com.

Meetup Event Format It is an empowering and rewarding experience to write an hour each week, at the same time and place. It serves as powerful support for building your daily writing discipline.

RSVP and please arrive 10–15 minutes early to get settled. At the Meetup our Organizer will lead introductions and then everyone will sit down and write.

Afterwards, feel free to get to know each other. Members often talk about their successes and challenges as writers. The Shut Up & Write!™ format brings a social facet to a normally isolated craft.

Our Meetups are a safe space for writers to work on their craft. No one will read or critique your writing.

“Writing is the only thing that, when I do it, I don't feel I should be doing something else.“ - Gloria Steinem

This is your time to write.
name: Shut Up & Write!™ Bern
organizer.name: Shut Up & Write!

category.name: writing
description:
Zurich Storytellers is a meetup of people who want to learn (more) how to craft good stories and an opportunity to practice telling them in a supportive friendly atmosphere.

Gain advice from experienced storytellers how to craft and tell your story in a compelling way. 

Stories shape the way we perceive our own causes and whether others will care about them. By giving purpose to our actions, the stories we tell ourselves (and others) are at the core of our success – or lack of it. 


Our meetup's format varies but generally time is divided between learning/sharing techniques of crafting story and discussing the stories members tell at the meetup. Member stories can be prepared in advance or improvised on the spot.

Here are 10 tips to help guide story design from beginning to end:

Hook us. Make us care about you. Paint the scene. Clearly state your fears, desires, the dilemma. Make us invested in the outcome. Introduce the conflict. Make us worried for you. Impress us with observations that are uniquely yours. Pull us into the moment when it all goes down. Conclude as a different person: Victorious? Defeated? Bewildered? Enlightened? …CHANGED.

FORMAT (can vary month to month)
18:00   Drinks and networking 
18:30   Guest storyteller(s), group exercises and discussion 
20:00   Member storytelling and group feedback
21:00   Good byes & networking

Because YOU ARE THE STORY YOU TELL
name: Zurich Storytellers Meetup
organizer.name: Joel Blom

description:
Wir bewegen Worte, damit der Funke überspringt. Es gibt Inspiration für Deine Kommunikation, für Worte voll Feuer. Beginne - vielleicht neu? - eine Liebesbeziehung zum Schreiben und Reden, mit kreativen Übungen und Austausch. In kleiner, persönlicher Runde, eine Begegnung am Feuer. Geniesse bei Wein und Food einen Abend für Deine lebendige Sprache.

Anmeldung gern per pn oder unter: friederike.kunath@email.de

category.name: writing
description:
I am searching for guest bloggers to participate in a lifestyle project entitled 'things I wish I knew in my twenties'. Ideally you'll be somewhere in your twenties, a keen blogger/writer (preferably with your own website) with a bit of life experience and a list of things you wish people had told you before you started adulting.
The size and length of the project will depend on the number of participants and how much we have to write about. So bring your laptop, your ideas and your personality along to the first meet up!
name: In my twenties

category.name: writing
description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group
organizer.name: Aaron Digulla

category.name: writing
description:
A group for anyone interested in meeting up for creative writing sessions in a cafe setting. Bring your laptop or your paper & pen, order a drink or a snack, and let's do some writing.  This is open to any writers, no matter what genre, language, or style you're writing in.

Meeting formats:

Start with a 10-minute free write prompt, then 30 minutes of writing on our own material, afterwards we keep going if we're on a roll or we stop and hang out.
name: Zürich Writing Sessions

description:
I am searching for guest bloggers to participate in a lifestyle project entitled 'things I wish I knew in my twenties'. Ideally you'll be somewhere in your twenties, a keen blogger/writer (preferably with your own website) with a bit of life experience and a list of things you wish people had told you before you started adulting.
The size and length of the project will depend on the number of participants and how much we have to write about. So bring your laptop, your ideas and your personality along to the first meet up!

category.name: writing
description:
Shut Up & Write!™ is more than a movement, more than a good idea. We’re a method of writing that delivers. As an international organization, we are thousands of writers in a worldwide community, but most importantly, we are writers who write together in a local cafe. Join us.

We have events every week, all over. Sometimes we talk after. Whatever you’re writing, whatever form it takes, wherever you are in your process, you won’t be the only one.

And if you need help with your writing, we offer that too. Want to know more? Check us out: www.shutupwrite.com. Or get in touch:
questions@shutupwrite.com.

Meetup Event Format It is an empowering and rewarding experience to write an hour each week, at the same time and place. It serves as powerful support for building your daily writing discipline.

RSVP and please arrive 10–15 minutes early to get settled. At the Meetup our Organizer will lead introductions and then everyone will sit down and write.

Afterwards, feel free to get to know each other. Members often talk about their successes and challenges as writers. The Shut Up & Write!™ format brings a social facet to a normally isolated craft.

Our Meetups are a safe space for writers to work on their craft. No one will read or critique your writing.

“Writing is the only thing that, when I do it, I don't feel I should be doing something else.“ - Gloria Steinem

This is your time to write.
name: Shut Up & Write!™ Bern
organizer.name: Shut Up & Write!

category.name: writing
description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group
organizer.name: Aaron Digulla

description:
A group for anyone interested in meeting up for creative writing sessions in a cafe setting. Bring your laptop or your paper & pen, order a drink or a snack, and let's do some writing.  This is open to any writers, no matter what genre, language, or style you're writing in.

Meeting formats:

Start with a 10-minute free write prompt, then 30 minutes of writing on our own material, afterwards we keep going if we're on a roll or we stop and hang out.

description: Are you suffering from writer's block? Then you are not alone, independent of whether you are writing a thesis, dissertation, research, book, blog or column. This group is intended towards bringing the budding writers together in a fun and friendly places in Zurich where we all can share our pain, experiences, tips and tricks. You do not have walk alone any longer. This group will be there to support you through your writing journey

category.name: writing
description:
Zurich Storytellers is a meetup of people who want to learn (more) how to craft good stories and an opportunity to practice telling them in a supportive friendly atmosphere.

Gain advice from experienced storytellers how to craft and tell your story in a compelling way. 

Stories shape the way we perceive our own causes and whether others will care about them. By giving purpose to our actions, the stories we tell ourselves (and others) are at the core of our success – or lack of it. 


Our meetup's format varies but generally time is divided between learning/sharing techniques of crafting story and discussing the stories members tell at the meetup. Member stories can be prepared in advance or improvised on the spot.

Here are 10 tips to help guide story design from beginning to end:

Hook us. Make us care about you. Paint the scene. Clearly state your fears, desires, the dilemma. Make us invested in the outcome. Introduce the conflict. Make us worried for you. Impress us with observations that are uniquely yours. Pull us into the moment when it all goes down. Conclude as a different person: Victorious? Defeated? Bewildered? Enlightened? …CHANGED.

FORMAT (can vary month to month)
18:00   Drinks and networking 
18:30   Guest storyteller(s), group exercises and discussion 
20:00   Member storytelling and group feedback
21:00   Good byes & networking

Because YOU ARE THE STORY YOU TELL
name: Zurich Storytellers Meetup

category.name: writing
description:
Salut tout le monde!
Hi everyone! (English version below)


L'objectif de ce groupe est de réunir des gens de tous horizons ayant tous un désir ou un besoin de changement dans leur vie, ainsi qu'une réelle volonté de passer à l'action! On est souvent bien dans seul face au changement, ce qui rend difficile de respecter ses engagements personnels et qui finit par nous faire laisser tomber...
L'idée ici est donc de trouver des personnes dans la même situation pour se motiver les uns les autres et pour que chacun atteignent ses objectifs! On est toujours plus efficace quand on sait que quelque part, quelqu'un compte sur nous pour y arriver!
J'aimerais également en profiter pour partager mon expérience en tant que Coach en Développement Personnel et vous faire découvrir certaines clés, certaines méthodes pour vous aider à Simplifier votre vie!


The purpose of this group is to bring together people from all walks of life, sharing a desire or a need for change in their lives, and a strong willingness to get take action and get started! We often feel alone in the face of change, which makes it difficult to respect our personal commitments and we end up giving up on our goals...
The idea here is to find people in a similar situation to motivate each other and to ensure everyone reaches their goals! We are always more efficient when we know that somewhere, someone is counting on us to succeed!
I would also like to take this opportunity to share with you my experience as a Lifestyle Coach and help you discover some tools and methods that will allow you to Redesign your life!
name: REDESIGN YOUR LIFE
organizer.name: Martin Perrier

category.name: writing
description:
Zurich Storytellers is a meetup of people who want to learn (more) how to craft good stories and an opportunity to practice telling them in a supportive friendly atmosphere.

Gain advice from experienced storytellers how to craft and tell your story in a compelling way. 

Stories shape the way we perceive our own causes and whether others will care about them. By giving purpose to our actions, the stories we tell ourselves (and others) are at the core of our success – or lack of it. 


Our meetup's format varies but generally time is divided between learning/sharing techniques of crafting story and discussing the stories members tell at the meetup. Member stories can be prepared in advance or improvised on the spot.

Here are 10 tips to help guide story design from beginning to end:

Hook us. Make us care about you. Paint the scene. Clearly state your fears, desires, the dilemma. Make us invested in the outcome. Introduce the conflict. Make us worried for you. Impress us with observations that are uniquely yours. Pull us into the moment when it all goes down. Conclude as a different person: Victorious? Defeated? Bewildered? Enlightened? …CHANGED.

FORMAT (can vary month to month)
18:00   Drinks and networking 
18:30   Guest storyteller(s), group exercises and discussion 
20:00   Member storytelling and group feedback
21:00   Good byes & networking

Because YOU ARE THE STORY YOU TELL
name: Zurich Storytellers Meetup

description:
Wir bewegen Worte, damit der Funke überspringt. Es gibt Inspiration für Deine Kommunikation, für Worte voll Feuer. Beginne - vielleicht neu? - eine Liebesbeziehung zum Schreiben und Reden, mit kreativen Übungen und Austausch. In kleiner, persönlicher Runde, eine Begegnung am Feuer. Geniesse bei Wein und Food einen Abend für Deine lebendige Sprache.

Anmeldung gern per pn oder unter: friederike.kunath@email.de

Wer sind wir? Friederike & Franz von www.schreibstimme.ch, https://www.facebook.com/schreibstimme/…

category.name: writing
description:
I am searching for guest bloggers to participate in a lifestyle project entitled 'things I wish I knew in my twenties'. Ideally you'll be somewhere in your twenties, a keen blogger/writer (preferably with your own website) with a bit of life experience and a list of things you wish people had told you before you started adulting.
The size and length of the project will depend on the number of participants and how much we have to write about. So bring your laptop, your ideas and your personality along to the first meet up!
name: In my twenties

category.name: writing
description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group
organizer.name: Aaron Digulla

category.name: writing
description:
A group for anyone interested in meeting up for creative writing sessions in a cafe setting. Bring your laptop or your paper & pen, order a drink or a snack, and let's do some writing.  This is open to any writers, no matter what genre, language, or style you're writing in.

Meeting formats:

Start with a 10-minute free write prompt, then 30 minutes of writing on our own material, afterwards we keep going if we're on a roll or we stop and hang out.
name: Zürich Writing Sessions

category.name: writing
description: Are you suffering from writer's block? Then you are not alone, independent of whether you are writing a thesis, dissertation, research, book, blog or column. This group is intended towards bringing the budding writers together in a fun and friendly places in Zurich where we all can share our pain, experiences, tips and tricks. You do not have walk alone any longer. This group will be there to support you through your writing journey

category.name: writing
description:
Salut tout le monde!
Hi everyone! (English version below)


L'objectif de ce groupe est de réunir des gens de tous horizons ayant tous un désir ou un besoin de changement dans leur vie, ainsi qu'une réelle volonté de passer à l'action! On est souvent bien dans seul face au changement, ce qui rend difficile de respecter ses engagements personnels et qui finit par nous faire laisser tomber...
L'idée ici est donc de trouver des personnes dans la même situation pour se motiver les uns les autres et pour que chacun atteignent ses objectifs! On est toujours plus efficace quand on sait que quelque part, quelqu'un compte sur nous pour y arriver!
J'aimerais également en profiter pour partager mon expérience en tant que Coach en Développement Personnel et vous faire découvrir certaines clés, certaines méthodes pour vous aider à Simplifier votre vie!


The purpose of this group is to bring together people from all walks of life, sharing a desire or a need for change in their lives, and a strong willingness to get take action and get started! We often feel alone in the face of change, which makes it difficult to respect our personal commitments and we end up giving up on our goals...
The idea here is to find people in a similar situation to motivate each other and to ensure everyone reaches their goals! We are always more efficient when we know that somewhere, someone is counting on us to succeed!
I would also like to take this opportunity to share with you my experience as a Lifestyle Coach and help you discover some tools and methods that will allow you to Redesign your life!
name: REDESIGN YOUR LIFE
organizer.name: Martin Perrier

category.name: writing
description:
Wir bewegen Worte, damit der Funke überspringt. Es gibt Inspiration für Deine Kommunikation, für Worte voll Feuer. Beginne - vielleicht neu? - eine Liebesbeziehung zum Schreiben und Reden, mit kreativen Übungen und Austausch. In kleiner, persönlicher Runde, eine Begegnung am Feuer. Geniesse bei Wein und Food einen Abend für Deine lebendige Sprache.

Anmeldung gern per pn oder unter: friederike.kunath@email.de

Wer sind wir? Friederike & Franz von www.schreibstimme.ch, https://www.facebook.com/schreibstimme/…
name: SchreibStimme Apéro: On fire!

category.name: writing
description:
I am searching for guest bloggers to participate in a lifestyle project entitled 'things I wish I knew in my twenties'. Ideally you'll be somewhere in your twenties, a keen blogger/writer (preferably with your own website) with a bit of life experience and a list of things you wish people had told you before you started adulting.
The size and length of the project will depend on the number of participants and how much we have to write about. So bring your laptop, your ideas and your personality along to the first meet up!
name: In my twenties
organizer.name: Kirsty Smith

category.name: writing
description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group
organizer.name: Aaron Digulla

category.name: writing
description:
A group for anyone interested in meeting up for creative writing sessions in a cafe setting. Bring your laptop or your paper & pen, order a drink or a snack, and let's do some writing.  This is open to any writers, no matter what genre, language, or style you're writing in.

Meeting formats:

Start with a 10-minute free write prompt, then 30 minutes of writing on our own material, afterwards we keep going if we're on a roll or we stop and hang out.
name: Zürich Writing Sessions
organizer.name: Dustin B

category.name: writing
description: Are you suffering from writer's block? Then you are not alone, independent of whether you are writing a thesis, dissertation, research, book, blog or column. This group is intended towards bringing the budding writers together in a fun and friendly places in Zurich where we all can share our pain, experiences, tips and tricks. You do not have walk alone any longer. This group will be there to support you through your writing journey
name: Zürich Writing Club

category.name: writing
description:
Zurich Storytellers is a meetup of people who want to learn (more) how to craft good stories and an opportunity to practice telling them in a supportive friendly atmosphere.

Gain advice from experienced storytellers how to craft and tell your story in a compelling way. 

Stories shape the way we perceive our own causes and whether others will care about them. By giving purpose to our actions, the stories we tell ourselves (and others) are at the core of our success – or lack of it. 


Our meetup's format varies but generally time is divided between learning/sharing techniques of crafting story and discussing the stories members tell at the meetup. Member stories can be prepared in advance or improvised on the spot.

Here are 10 tips to help guide story design from beginning to end:

Hook us. Make us care about you. Paint the scene. Clearly state your fears, desires, the dilemma. Make us invested in the outcome. Introduce the conflict. Make us worried for you. Impress us with observations that are uniquely yours. Pull us into the moment when it all goes down. Conclude as a different person: Victorious? Defeated? Bewildered? Enlightened? …CHANGED.

FORMAT (can vary month to month)
18:00   Drinks and networking 
18:30   Guest storyteller(s), group exercises and discussion 
20:00   Member storytelling and group feedback
21:00   Good byes & networking

Because YOU ARE THE STORY YOU TELL
name: Zurich Storytellers Meetup

category.name: writing
description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group
organizer.name: Aaron Digulla

category.name: writing
description:
A group for anyone interested in meeting up for creative writing sessions in a cafe setting. Bring your laptop or your paper & pen, order a drink or a snack, and let's do some writing.  This is open to any writers, no matter what genre, language, or style you're writing in.

Meeting formats:

Start with a 10-minute free write prompt, then 30 minutes of writing on our own material, afterwards we keep going if we're on a roll or we stop and hang out.
name: Zürich Writing Sessions
organizer.name: Dustin B

category.name: writing
description: Are you suffering from writer's block? Then you are not alone, independent of whether you are writing a thesis, dissertation, research, book, blog or column. This group is intended towards bringing the budding writers together in a fun and friendly places in Zurich where we all can share our pain, experiences, tips and tricks. You do not have walk alone any longer. This group will be there to support you through your writing journey

category.name: writing
description:
Zurich Storytellers is a meetup of people who want to learn (more) how to craft good stories and an opportunity to practice telling them in a supportive friendly atmosphere.

Gain advice from experienced storytellers how to craft and tell your story in a compelling way. 

Stories shape the way we perceive our own causes and whether others will care about them. By giving purpose to our actions, the stories we tell ourselves (and others) are at the core of our success – or lack of it. 


Our meetup's format varies but generally time is divided between learning/sharing techniques of crafting story and discussing the stories members tell at the meetup. Member stories can be prepared in advance or improvised on the spot.

Here are 10 tips to help guide story design from beginning to end:

Hook us. Make us care about you. Paint the scene. Clearly state your fears, desires, the dilemma. Make us invested in the outcome. Introduce the conflict. Make us worried for you. Impress us with observations that are uniquely yours. Pull us into the moment when it all goes down. Conclude as a different person: Victorious? Defeated? Bewildered? Enlightened? …CHANGED.

FORMAT (can vary month to month)
18:00   Drinks and networking 
18:30   Guest storyteller(s), group exercises and discussion 
20:00   Member storytelling and group feedback
21:00   Good byes & networking

Because YOU ARE THE STORY YOU TELL
name: Zurich Storytellers Meetup
organizer.name: Joel Blom

category.name: writing
description:
I am searching for guest bloggers to participate in a lifestyle project entitled 'things I wish I knew in my twenties'. Ideally you'll be somewhere in your twenties, a keen blogger/writer (preferably with your own website) with a bit of life experience and a list of things you wish people had told you before you started adulting.
The size and length of the project will depend on the number of participants and how much we have to write about. So bring your laptop, your ideas and your personality along to the first meet up!
name: In my twenties

The size and length of the project will depend on the number of participants and how much we have to write about. So bring your laptop, your ideas and your personality along to the first meet up!

category.name: writing
description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group
organizer.name: Aaron Digulla

description:
A group for anyone interested in meeting up for creative writing sessions in a cafe setting. Bring your laptop or your paper & pen, order a drink or a snack, and let's do some writing.  This is open to any writers, no matter what genre, language, or style you're writing in.

Meeting formats:

Start with a 10-minute free write prompt, then 30 minutes of writing on our own material, afterwards we keep going if we're on a roll or we stop and hang out.
name: Zürich Writing Sessions

category.name: writing
description:
Zurich Storytellers is a meetup of people who want to learn (more) how to craft good stories and an opportunity to practice telling them in a supportive friendly atmosphere.

Gain advice from experienced storytellers how to craft and tell your story in a compelling way. 

Stories shape the way we perceive our own causes and whether others will care about them. By giving purpose to our actions, the stories we tell ourselves (and others) are at the core of our success – or lack of it. 


Our meetup's format varies but generally time is divided between learning/sharing techniques of crafting story and discussing the stories members tell at the meetup. Member stories can be prepared in advance or improvised on the spot.

Here are 10 tips to help guide story design from beginning to end:

Hook us. Make us care about you. Paint the scene. Clearly state your fears, desires, the dilemma. Make us invested in the outcome. Introduce the conflict. Make us worried for you. Impress us with observations that are uniquely yours. Pull us into the moment when it all goes down. Conclude as a different person: Victorious? Defeated? Bewildered? Enlightened? …CHANGED.

FORMAT (can vary month to month)
18:00   Drinks and networking 
18:30   Guest storyteller(s), group exercises and discussion 
20:00   Member storytelling and group feedback
21:00   Good byes & networking

Because YOU ARE THE STORY YOU TELL
name: Zurich Storytellers Meetup
organizer.name: Joel Blom

description:
Wir bewegen Worte, damit der Funke überspringt. Es gibt Inspiration für Deine Kommunikation, für Worte voll Feuer. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.

Meeting formats:

category.name: writing
description:
Zurich Storytellers is a meetup of people who want to learn (more) how to craft good stories and an opportunity to practice telling them in a supportive friendly atmosphere.

Gain advice from experienced storytellers how to craft and tell your story in a compelling way. 

Stories shape the way we perceive our own causes and whether others will care about them. By giving purpose to our actions, the stories we tell ourselves (and others) are at the core of our success – or lack of it. 


Our meetup's format varies but generally time is divided between learning/sharing techniques of crafting story and discussing the stories members tell at the meetup. Member stories can be prepared in advance or improvised on the spot.

Here are 10 tips to help guide story design from beginning to end:

Hook us. Make us care about you. Paint the scene. Clearly state your fears, desires, the dilemma. Make us invested in the outcome. Introduce the conflict. Make us worried for you. Impress us with observations that are uniquely yours. Pull us into the moment when it all goes down. Conclude as a different person: Victorious? Defeated? Bewildered? Enlightened? …CHANGED.

FORMAT (can vary month to month)
18:00   Drinks and networking 
18:30   Guest storyteller(s), group exercises and discussion 
20:00   Member storytelling and group feedback
21:00   Good byes & networking

Because YOU ARE THE STORY YOU TELL
name: Zurich Storytellers Meetup
organizer.name: Joel Blom

description:

Ideally you'll be somewhere in your twenties, a keen blogger/writer (preferably with your own website) with a bit of life experience and a list of things you wish people had told you before you started adulting.
The size and length of the project will depend on the number of participants and how much we have to write about. So bring your laptop, your ideas and your personality along to the first meet up!

category.name: writing
description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group
organizer.name: Aaron Digulla

Meeting formats:
